info.title: UDP-MIB MIB API
info.description:
The MIB module for managing UDP implementations.
    Copyright (C) The Internet Society (2005).  This
    version of this MIB module is part of RFC 4113;
    see the RFC itself for full legal notices.

‚ö†Ô∏è **IMPORTANT - MIB DATA ACCESS**:
This YANG model exists for SMIv2-to-YANG translation purposes, but MIB data on IOS-XE devices is primarily accessed via **SNMP protocol**, not RESTCONF.

**RESTCONF Limitation**: Many MIB paths may return 404 errors via RESTCONF `/data` endpoints because the device exposes MIB data through SNMP, not the YANG datastore.

**Recommended Access Methods**:
- Use SNMP (v2c/v3) to query MIB data directly
- Use NETCONF `<get>` operations for devices supporting YANG-modeled MIB access
- Check device capabilities: some newer IOS-XE versions may support limited RESTCONF access to specific MIBs

**YANG Model Purpose**: These YANG models define the structure of SNMP MIBs in YANG format for tooling compatibility, but do not guarantee RESTCONF data availability.


**üìä YANG Tree:** [View UDP-MIB structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/UDP-MIB.html)

get.description: Retrieve udp operational data from MIB

schema.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP
          users.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpInDatagrams.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP
          users.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpNoPorts.description:
The total number of received UDP datagrams for which
          there was no application at the destination port.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpInErrors.description:
The number of received UDP datagrams that could not be
          delivered for reasons other than the lack of an
          application at the destination port.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpOutDatagrams.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams sent from this
          entity.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpHCInDatagrams.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP
          users, for devices that can receive more than 1
          million UDP datagrams per second.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpHCOutDatagrams.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams sent from this
          entity, for devices that can transmit more than 1
          million UDP datagrams per second.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

get.description: Retrieve udpTable operational data from MIB

schema.description:
A table containing IPv4-specific UDP listener
        information.  It contains information about all local
        IPv4 UDP end-points on which an application is
        currently accepting datagrams.  This table has been
        deprecated in favor of the version neutral
        udpEndpointTable.

udpEntry.description: Information about a particular current UDP listener.

udpLocalAddress.description:
The local IP address for this UDP listener.  In the
            case of a UDP listener that is willing to accept
            datagrams for any IP interface associated with the
            node, the value 0.0.0.0 is used.

udpLocalPort.description: The local port number for this UDP listener.

get.description: Retrieve list of udpEntry entries from MIB

schema.description: Information about a particular current UDP listener.

udpLocalAddress.description:
The local IP address for this UDP listener.  In the
            case of a UDP listener that is willing to accept
            datagrams for any IP interface associated with the
            node, the value 0.0.0.0 is used.

udpLocalPort.description: The local port number for this UDP listener.

get.description: Retrieve specific udpEntry entry by key from MIB

udpLocalAddress.description:
The local IP address for this UDP listener.  In the
            case of a UDP listener that is willing to accept
            datagrams for any IP interface associated with the
            node, the value 0.0.0.0 is used.

udpLocalPort.description: The local port number for this UDP listener.

get.description: Retrieve udpEndpointTable operational data from MIB

udpEndpointLocalAddressType.description:
The address type of udpEndpointLocalAddress.  Only
            IPv4, IPv4z, IPv6, and IPv6z addresses are expected, or
            unknown(0) if datagrams for all local IP addresses are
            accepted.

udpEndpointLocalAddress.description:
The local IP address for this UDP endpoint.
            
            The value of this object can be represented in three
            
            possible ways, depending on the characteristics of the
            listening application:
            
            1. For an application that is willing to accept both
               IPv4 and IPv6 datagrams, the value of this object
               must be ''h (a zero-length octet-string), with
               the value of the corresponding instance of the
               udpEndpointLocalAddressType object being unknown(0).
            
            2. For an application that is willing to accept only IPv4
               or only IPv6 datagrams, the value of this object
               must be '0.0.0.0' or '::', respectively, while the
               corresponding instance of the
               udpEndpointLocalAddressType object represents the
               appropriate address type.
            
            3. For an application that is listening for data
               destined only to a specific IP address, the value
               of this object is the specific IP address for which
               this node is receiving packets, with the
               corresponding instance of the
               udpEndpointLocalAddressType object representing the
               appropriate address type.
            
            As this object is used in the index for the
            udpEndpointTable, implementors of this table should be
            careful not to create entries that would result in OIDs
            with more than 128 subidentifiers; else the information
            cannot be accessed using SNMPv1, SNMPv2c, or SNMPv3.

udpEndpointLocalPort.description: The local port number for this UDP endpoint.

udpEndpointRemoteAddressType.description:
The address type of udpEndpointRemoteAddress.  Only
            IPv4, IPv4z, IPv6, and IPv6z addresses are expected, or
            unknown(0) if datagrams for all remote IP addresses are
            accepted.  Also, note that some combinations of
            
            udpEndpointLocalAdressType and
            udpEndpointRemoteAddressType are not supported.  In
            particular, if the value of this object is not
            unknown(0), it is expected to always refer to the
            same IP version as udpEndpointLocalAddressType.

udpEndpointRemoteAddress.description:
The remote IP address for this UDP endpoint.  If
            datagrams from any remote system are to be accepted,
            this value is ''h (a zero-length octet-string).
            Otherwise, it has the type described by
            udpEndpointRemoteAddressType and is the address of the
            remote system from which datagrams are to be accepted
            (or to which all datagrams will be sent).
            
            As this object is used in the index for the
            udpEndpointTable, implementors of this table should be
            careful not to create entries that would result in OIDs
            with more than 128 subidentifiers; else the information
            cannot be accessed using SNMPv1, SNMPv2c, or SNMPv3.

udpEndpointRemotePort.description:
The remote port number for this UDP endpoint.  If
            datagrams from any remote system are to be accepted,
            this value is zero.

udpEndpointInstance.description:
The instance of this tuple.  This object is used to
            distinguish among multiple processes 'connected' to
            the same UDP endpoint.  For example, on a system
            implementing the BSD sockets interface, this would be
            used to support the SO_REUSEADDR and SO_REUSEPORT
            socket options.

udpEndpointProcess.description:
The system's process ID for the process associated with
            this endpoint, or zero if there is no such process.
            This value is expected to be the same as
            HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrSWRunIndex or SYSAPPL-MIB::
            sysApplElmtRunIndex for some row in the appropriate
            tables.

get.description: Retrieve specific udpEndpointEntry entry by key from MIB

            this endpoint, or zero if there is no such process.
            This value is expected to be the same as
            HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrSWRunIndex or SYSAPPL-MIB::
            sysApplElmtRunIndex for some row in the appropriate
            tables.

udp.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP
          users.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpInDatagrams.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP
          users.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpNoPorts.description:
The total number of received UDP datagrams for which
          there was no application at the destination port.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpInErrors.description:
The number of received UDP datagrams that could not be
          delivered for reasons other than the lack of an
          application at the destination port.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpOutDatagrams.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams sent from this
          entity.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpHCInDatagrams.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP
          users, for devices that can receive more than 1
          million UDP datagrams per second.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpHCOutDatagrams.description:
The total number of UDP datagrams sent from this
          entity, for devices that can transmit more than 1
          million UDP datagrams per second.
          
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at re-initialization of the management system, and at
          other times as indicated by discontinuities in the
          value of sysUpTime.

udpTable.description:
A table containing IPv4-specific UDP listener
        information.  It contains information about all local
        IPv4 UDP end-points on which an application is
        currently accepting datagrams.  This table has been
        deprecated in favor of the version neutral
        udpEndpointTable.

udpEntry.description: Information about a particular current UDP listener.

udpLocalAddress.description:
The local IP address for this UDP listener.  In the
            case of a UDP listener that is willing to accept
            datagrams for any IP interface associated with the
            node, the value 0.0.0.0 is used.

udpLocalPort.description: The local port number for this UDP listener.

udpEndpointLocalAddressType.description:
The address type of udpEndpointLocalAddress.  Only
            IPv4, IPv4z, IPv6, and IPv6z addresses are expected, or
            unknown(0) if datagrams for all local IP addresses are
            accepted.

udpEndpointLocalAddress.description:
The local IP address for this UDP endpoint.
            
            The value of this object can be represented in three
            
            possible ways, depending on the characteristics of the
            listening application:
            
            1. For an application that is willing to accept both
               IPv4 and IPv6 datagrams, the value of this object
               must be ''h (a zero-length octet-string), with
               the value of the corresponding instance of the
               udpEndpointLocalAddressType object being unknown(0).
            
            2. For an application that is willing to accept only IPv4
               or only IPv6 datagrams, the value of this object
               must be '0.0.0.0' or '::', respectively, while the
               corresponding instance of the
               udpEndpointLocalAddressType object represents the
               appropriate address type.
            
            3. For an application that is listening for data
               destined only to a specific IP address, the value
               of this object is the specific IP address for which
               this node is receiving packets, with the
               corresponding instance of the
               udpEndpointLocalAddressType object representing the
               appropriate address type.
            
            As this object is used in the index for the
            udpEndpointTable, implementors of this table should be
            careful not to create entries that would result in OIDs
            with more than 128 subidentifiers; else the information
            cannot be accessed using SNMPv1, SNMPv2c, or SNMPv3.

udpEndpointLocalPort.description: The local port number for this UDP endpoint.

udpEndpointRemoteAddressType.description:
The address type of udpEndpointRemoteAddress.  Only
            IPv4, IPv4z, IPv6, and IPv6z addresses are expected, or
            unknown(0) if datagrams for all remote IP addresses are
            accepted.  Also, note that some combinations of
            
            udpEndpointLocalAdressType and
            udpEndpointRemoteAddressType are not supported.  In
            particular, if the value of this object is not
            unknown(0), it is expected to always refer to the
            same IP version as udpEndpointLocalAddressType.

udpEndpointRemoteAddress.description:
The remote IP address for this UDP endpoint.  If
            datagrams from any remote system are to be accepted,
            this value is ''h (a zero-length octet-string).
            Otherwise, it has the type described by
            udpEndpointRemoteAddressType and is the address of the
            remote system from which datagrams are to be accepted
            (or to which all datagrams will be sent).
            
            As this object is used in the index for the
            udpEndpointTable, implementors of this table should be
            careful not to create entries that would result in OIDs
            with more than 128 subidentifiers; else the information
            cannot be accessed using SNMPv1, SNMPv2c, or SNMPv3.

udpEndpointRemotePort.description:
The remote port number for this UDP endpoint.  If
            datagrams from any remote system are to be accepted,
            this value is zero.

udpEndpointInstance.description:
The instance of this tuple.  This object is used to
            distinguish among multiple processes 'connected' to
            the same UDP endpoint.  For example, on a system
            implementing the BSD sockets interface, this would be
            used to support the SO_REUSEADDR and SO_REUSEPORT
            socket options.

udpEndpointProcess.description:
The system's process ID for the process associated with
            this endpoint, or zero if there is no such process.
            This value is expected to be the same as
            HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrSWRunIndex or SYSAPPL-MIB::
            sysApplElmtRunIndex for some row in the appropriate
            tables.

UDP-MIB_udpEntry.description: Information about a particular current UDP listener.

The local IP address for this UDP listener.  In the
            case of a UDP listener that is willing to accept
            datagrams for any IP interface associated with the
            node, the value 0.0.0.0 is used.

udpLocalPort.description: The local port number for this UDP listener.

udpEndpointLocalAddressType.description:
The address type of udpEndpointLocalAddress.  Only
            IPv4, IPv4z, IPv6, and IPv6z addresses are expected, or
            unknown(0) if datagrams for all local IP addresses are
            accepted.

            listening application:

               IPv4 and IPv6 datagrams, the value of this object
               must be ''h (a zero-length octet-string), with
               the value of the corresponding instance of the
               udpEndpointLocalAddressType object being unknown(0).
            
            2. For an application that is willing to accept only IPv4
               or only IPv6 datagrams, the value of this object
               must be '0.0.0.0' or '::', respectively, while the
               corresponding instance of the
               udpEndpointLocalAddressType object represents the
               appropriate address type.
            
            3. For an application that is listening for data
               destined only to a specific IP address, the value
               of this object is the specific IP address for which
               this node is receiving packets, with the
               corresponding instance of the
               udpEndpointLocalAddressType object representing the
               appropriate address type.

            udpEndpointTable, implementors of this table should be
            careful not to create entries that would result in OIDs
            with more than 128 subidentifiers; else the information
            cannot be accessed using SNMPv1, SNMPv2c, or SNMPv3.

udpEndpointLocalPort.description: The local port number for this UDP endpoint.

The address type of udpEndpointRemoteAddress.  Only
            IPv4, IPv4z, IPv6, and IPv6z addresses are expected, or
            unknown(0) if datagrams for all remote IP addresses are
            accepted.  Also, note that some combinations of
            
            udpEndpointLocalAdressType and
            udpEndpointRemoteAddressType are not supported.  In
            particular, if the value of this object is not
            unknown(0), it is expected to always refer to the
            same IP version as udpEndpointLocalAddressType.

udpEndpointRemoteAddress.description:
The remote IP address for this UDP endpoint.  If
            datagrams from any remote system are to be accepted,
            this value is ''h (a zero-length octet-string).
            Otherwise, it has the type described by
            udpEndpointRemoteAddressType and is the address of the
            remote system from which datagrams are to be accepted
            (or to which all datagrams will be sent).
            
            As this object is used in the index for the
            udpEndpointTable, implementors of this table should be
            careful not to create entries that would result in OIDs
            with more than 128 subidentifiers; else the information
            cannot be accessed using SNMPv1, SNMPv2c, or SNMPv3.

udpEndpointRemotePort.description:
The remote port number for this UDP endpoint.  If
            datagrams from any remote system are to be accepted,
            this value is zero.

udpEndpointInstance.description:
The instance of this tuple.  This object is used to
            distinguish among multiple processes 'connected' to
            the same UDP endpoint.  For example, on a system
            implementing the BSD sockets interface, this would be
            used to support the SO_REUSEADDR and SO_REUSEPORT
            socket options.

udpEndpointProcess.description:
The system's process ID for the process associated with
            this endpoint, or zero if there is no such process.
            This value is expected to be the same as
            HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrSWRunIndex or SYSAPPL-MIB::
            sysApplElmtRunIndex for some row in the appropriate
            tables.
